Package controller

Class MinesweeperController

java.lang.Object
controller.MinesweeperController
public class MinesweeperController
extends java.lang.Object
This class is designed to mediate any necessary interactions between the model and the view that cannot otherwise be handled by the Observer/Observable design pattern for the Minesweeper game. This controller's primary interactions with the model consist of interpreting the player's input provided by the view (taking steps and placing flags) and retrieving any necessary gameplay state information stored in the model. This includes information such as whether or not the game is over or if the player won or lost. To construct this class, an instance of MinesweeperModel is needed.
Author:
Katherine Wilson, Giang Huong Pham
See Also:
MinesweeperView, MinesweeperModel, Space

  • Field Details

    • model

      private MinesweeperModel model
      Minesweeper model that this controller interacts with. This model will receive input from the view that is passed to this controller and provide gameplay data for functions that return it to the view, such as getMineFields()

  • Constructor Details

    • MinesweeperController

      public MinesweeperController​(MinesweeperModel model)
      Creates a MinesweeperController object. A reference to the MinesweeperModel parameter is stored by this object and will act as the specific instance that this controller interacts with.
      Parameters:
      model - MinesweeperModel instance associated with this controller instance.

  • Method Details

    • takeStep

      public boolean takeStep​(int x, int y) throws IllegalStepException
      Uses the x and y coordinates given based on the player's input to add a step to the model. The values are used to instantiate a Point object, which is then passed to the model, which will update the game's state accordingly.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the player's new step in the minefield.
      y - The y-coordinate of the player's new step in the minefield.
      Returns:
      true if a safe step was made.
      false if the player stepped on a mine.
      Throws:
      IllegalStepException - when an invalid location is given for a step. This occurs when:
      • The player attempts to step on a flag
      • The player attempts to step on an already revealed space

    • toggleFlag

      public boolean toggleFlag​(int x, int y) throws IllegalFlagPlacementException
      Uses the x and y coordinates given based on the user's input to add a flag to the model's minefield. The values are used to instantiate a Point object, which is passed to the model to update the game's state accordingly. This function will also remove flags.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate of the player's new flag in the minefield.
      y - The y-coordinate of the player's new flag in the minefield.
      Returns:
      true when a flag is added and false when a flag is removed.
      Throws:
      IllegalFlagPlacementException - when an invalid location is given for flag placement. This occurs when:
      • The player attempts to place a flag on a revealed safe space
      • The player attempts to place a flag when they're out of flags

    • getTime

      public int getTime()
      Returns the time that has elapsed since the start of the game.
      Returns:
      the time (in seconds) that have elapsed since the player's first move.

    • setTime

      public void setTime​(int time)
      Manually sets the elapsed time stored in the model.
      Parameters:
      time - new elapsed time (in seconds).

    • saveGameState

      public void saveGameState()
      Signals to the model that a new game save should be created.
